description: Retrieves the configuration parameters and status for a Batch Operations job. For more information, see S3 Batch Operations in the Amazon S3 User Guide. To use the DescribeJob operation, you must have permission to perform the s3:DescribeJob action. Related actions include:

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the S3 Batch Operations job.

parameters.name: JobId
parameters.description: The ID for the job whose information you want to retrieve.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: The ID for the specified job.

nested_items.name: ConfirmationRequired
nested_items.description: Indicates whether confirmation is required before Amazon S3 begins running the specified job. Confirmation is required only for jobs created through the Amazon S3 console.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for this job, if one was provided in this job's Create Job request.

nested_items.name: JobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for this job.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the specified job.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: Indicates which of the available formats the specified manifest uses.

nested_items.name: Fields
nested_items.description: If the specified manifest object is in the S3BatchOperations_CSV_20180820 format, this element describes which columns contain the required data.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ObjectArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a manifest object.

nested_items.name: ObjectVersionId
nested_items.description: The optional version ID to identify a specific version of the manifest object.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The ETag for the specified manifest object.

nested_items.name: Operation
nested_items.description: The operation that the specified job is configured to run on the objects listed in the manifest.

nested_items.name: LambdaInvoke
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to invoke an Lambda function on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: FunctionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Lambda function that the specified job will invoke on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: InvocationSchemaVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies the schema version for the payload that Batch Operations sends when invoking an Lambda function. Version 1.0 is the default. Version 2.0 is required when you use Batch Operations to invoke Lambda functions that act on directory buckets, or if you need to specify UserArguments. For more information, see Automate object processing in Amazon S3 directory buckets with S3 Batch Operations and Lambda in the Amazon Web Services Storage Blog.

nested_items.name: UserArguments
nested_items.description: Key-value pairs that are passed in the payload that Batch Operations sends when invoking an Lambda function. You must specify InvocationSchemaVersion 2.0 for LambdaInvoke operations that include UserArguments. For more information, see Automate object processing in Amazon S3 directory buckets with S3 Batch Operations and Lambda in the Amazon Web Services Storage Blog.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: S3PutObjectCopy
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to run a PUT Copy object call on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: TargetResource
nested_items.description: Specifies the destination bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the batch copy operation.

nested_items.name: AccessControlGrants
nested_items.description: (dict) ---

nested_items.name: NewObjectMetadata
nested_items.description: If you don't provide this parameter, Amazon S3 copies all the metadata from the original objects. If you specify an empty set, the new objects will have no tags. Otherwise, Amazon S3 assigns the supplied tags to the new objects.

nested_items.name: UserMetadata
nested_items.description: (string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ContentLength
nested_items.description: This member has been deprecated.

nested_items.name: ContentMD5
nested_items.description: This member has been deprecated.

nested_items.name: RequesterCharged
nested_items.description: This member has been deprecated.

nested_items.name: SSEAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing objects in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: NewObjectTagging
nested_items.description: Specifies a list of tags to add to the destination objects after they are copied. If NewObjectTagging is not specified, the tags of the source objects are copied to destination objects by default.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Value of the tag.

nested_items.name: RedirectLocation
nested_items.description: If the destination bucket is configured as a website, specifies an optional metadata property for website redirects, x-amz-website-redirect-location. Allows webpage redirects if the object copy is accessed through a website endpoint.

nested_items.name: StorageClass
nested_items.description: Specify the storage class for the destination objects in a Copy operation.

nested_items.name: SSEAwsKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Specifies the KMS key ID (Key ID, Key ARN, or Key Alias) to use for object encryption. If the KMS key doesn't exist in the same account that's issuing the command, you must use the full Key ARN not the Key ID.

nested_items.name: TargetKeyPrefix
nested_items.description: Specifies the folder prefix that you want the objects to be copied into. For example, to copy objects into a folder named Folder1 in the destination bucket, set the TargetKeyPrefix property to Folder1.

nested_items.name: ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus
nested_items.description: The legal hold status to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: ObjectLockMode
nested_items.description: The retention mode to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: ObjectLockRetainUntilDate
nested_items.description: The date when the applied object retention configuration expires on all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: BucketKeyEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key for object encryption with server-side encryption using Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS). Setting this header to true causes Amazon S3 to use an S3 Bucket Key for object encryption with SSE-KMS.

nested_items.name: ChecksumAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Indicates the algorithm that you want Amazon S3 to use to create the checksum. For more information, see Checking object integrity in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: S3PutObjectAcl
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to run a PutObjectAcl call on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: Grants
nested_items.description: (dict) ---

nested_items.name: S3PutObjectTagging
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to run a PUT Object tagging call on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: TagSet
nested_items.description: (dict) ---

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Value of the tag.

nested_items.name: S3DeleteObjectTagging
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to execute a DELETE Object tagging call on every object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: S3InitiateRestoreObject
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to initiate restore requests for every archived object in the manifest.

nested_items.name: ExpirationInDays
nested_items.description: This argument specifies how long the S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive object remains available in Amazon S3. S3 Initiate Restore Object jobs that target S3 Glacier and S3 Glacier Deep Archive objects require ExpirationInDays set to 1 or greater.

nested_items.name: GlacierJobTier
nested_items.description: S3 Batch Operations supports STANDARD and BULK retrieval tiers, but not the EXPEDITED retrieval tier.

nested_items.name: S3PutObjectLegalHold
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration for an S3 Object Lock legal hold operation that an S3 Batch Operations job passes to every object to the underlying PutObjectLegalHold API operation. For more information, see Using S3 Object Lock legal hold with S3 Batch Operations in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: LegalHold
nested_items.description: Contains the Object Lock legal hold status to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The Object Lock legal hold status to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: S3PutObjectRetention
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration parameters for the Object Lock retention action for an S3 Batch Operations job. Batch Operations passes every object to the underlying PutObjectRetention API operation. For more information, see Using S3 Object Lock retention with S3 Batch Operations in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: BypassGovernanceRetention
nested_items.description: Indicates if the action should be applied to objects in the Batch Operations job even if they have Object Lock GOVERNANCE type in place.

nested_items.name: Retention
nested_items.description: Contains the Object Lock retention mode to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job. For more information, see Using S3 Object Lock retention with S3 Batch Operations in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: RetainUntilDate
nested_items.description: The date when the applied Object Lock retention will expire on all objects set by the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The Object Lock retention mode to be applied to all objects in the Batch Operations job.

nested_items.name: S3ReplicateObject
nested_items.description: Directs the specified job to invoke ReplicateObject on every object in the job's manifest.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority of the specified job.

nested_items.name: ProgressSummary
nested_items.description: Describes the total number of tasks that the specified job has run, the number of tasks that succeeded, and the number of tasks that failed.

nested_items.name: ElapsedTimeInActiveSeconds
nested_items.description: Indicates the elapsed time in seconds the job has been in the Active job state.

nested_items.name: StatusUpdateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for updating the job.

nested_items.name: FailureReasons
nested_items.description: If the specified job failed, this field contains information describing the failure.

nested_items.name: FailureCode
nested_items.description: The failure code, if any, for the specified job.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: The failure reason, if any, for the specified job.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the bucket where specified job-completion report will be stored.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The format of the specified job-completion report.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the specified job will generate a job-completion report.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: An optional prefix to describe where in the specified bucket the job-completion report will be stored. Amazon S3 stores the job-completion report at <prefix>/job-<job-id>/report.json.

nested_items.name: ReportScope
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the job-completion report will include details of all tasks or only failed tasks.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp indicating when this job was created.

nested_items.name: TerminationDate
nested_items.description: A timestamp indicating when this job terminated. A job's termination date is the date and time when it succeeded, failed, or was canceled.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role assigned to run the tasks for this job.

nested_items.name: SuspendedDate
nested_items.description: The timestamp when this job was suspended, if it has been suspended.

nested_items.name: SuspendedCause
nested_items.description: The reason why the specified job was suspended. A job is only suspended if you create it through the Amazon S3 console. When you create the job, it enters the Suspended state to await confirmation before running. After you confirm the job, it automatically exits the Suspended state.

nested_items.name: ManifestGenerator
nested_items.description: The manifest generator that was used to generate a job manifest for this job.

nested_items.name: S3JobManifestGenerator
nested_items.description: The S3 job ManifestGenerator's configuration details.

nested_items.name: ExpectedBucketOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the bucket the generated manifest is written to. If provided the generated manifest bucket's owner Amazon Web Services account ID must match this value, else the job fails.

nested_items.name: SourceBucket
nested_items.description: The ARN of the source bucket used by the ManifestGenerator.

nested_items.name: ManifestOutputLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies the location the generated manifest will be written to. Manifests can't be written to directory buckets. For more information, see Directory buckets.

nested_items.name: ExpectedManifestBucketOwner
nested_items.description: The Account ID that owns the bucket the generated manifest is written to.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The bucket ARN the generated manifest should be written to.

nested_items.name: ManifestPrefix
nested_items.description: Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the manifest applies.

nested_items.name: ManifestEncryption
nested_items.description: Specifies what encryption should be used when the generated manifest objects are written.

nested_items.name: KeyId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric encryption customer managed key to use for encrypting generated manifest objects.

nested_items.name: ManifestFormat
nested_items.description: The format of the generated manifest.

nested_items.name: EligibleForReplication
nested_items.description: Include objects in the generated manifest only if they are eligible for replication according to the Replication configuration on the source bucket.

nested_items.name: CreatedAfter
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects that were created after this time.

nested_items.name: CreatedBefore
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects that were created before this time.

nested_items.name: ObjectReplicationStatuses
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects that have one of the specified Replication statuses.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KeyNameConstraint
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects whose object keys match the string constraints specified for MatchAnyPrefix, MatchAnySuffix, and MatchAnySubstring.

nested_items.name: MatchAnyPrefix
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes objects where the specified string appears at the start of the object key string. Each KeyNameConstraint filter accepts an array of strings with a length of 1 string.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MatchAnySuffix
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes objects where the specified string appears at the end of the object key string. Each KeyNameConstraint filter accepts an array of strings with a length of 1 string.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MatchAnySubstring
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes objects where the specified string appears anywhere within the object key string. Each KeyNameConstraint filter accepts an array of strings with a length of 1 string.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ObjectSizeGreaterThanBytes
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects whose file size is greater than the specified number of bytes.

nested_items.name: ObjectSizeLessThanBytes
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects whose file size is less than the specified number of bytes.

nested_items.name: MatchAnyStorageClass
nested_items.description: If provided, the generated manifest includes only source bucket objects that are stored with the specified storage class.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnableManifestOutput
nested_items.description: Determines whether or not to write the job's generated manifest to a bucket.

nested_items.name: GeneratedManifestDescriptor
nested_items.description: The attribute of the JobDescriptor containing details about the job's generated manifest.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The format of the generated manifest.

nested_items.name: ObjectArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a manifest object.

nested_items.name: ObjectVersionId
nested_items.description: The optional version ID to identify a specific version of the manifest object.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The ETag for the specified manifest object.
